sub_topic: Prove that the power set of a set is always larger than the set itself.
message_1: Let's say you have a set A with 4 elements. What is the cardinality of the power set of A and how does it compare to the cardinality of A itself?
message_2:
The cardinality of a power set of a set A is given by the formula 2^n, where n is the number of elements in set A. In this case, set A has 4 elements, so the cardinality of the power set of A is 2^4 = 16.

Comparing the cardinality of the power set of A to the cardinality of A itself, we can see that the power set has significantly more elements (16) than the original set A (4).
